lines.text: Knocking within. Enter a Porter

lines.speaker: porter
lines.text: Heres a knocking indeed! If a man were porter of hellgate, he should have old turning the key. Knock, knock, knock! Whos there, i the name of Beelzebub Heres a farmer, that hanged himself on the expectation of plenty: come in time have napkins enow about you here youll sweat fort. Knock, knock! Whos there, in the other devils name Faith, heres an equivocator, that could swear in both the scales against either scale who committed treason enough for Gods sake, yet could not equivocate to heaven: O, come in, equivocator. Knock, knock, knock! Whos there Faith, heres an English tailor come hither, for stealing out of a French hose: come in, tailor here you may roast your goose. Knock, knock never at quiet! What are you But this place is too cold for hell. Ill devilporter it no further: I had thought to have let in some of all professions that go the primrose way to the everlasting bonfire. Anon, anon! I pray you, remember the porter.
Knocking within
Knocking within
Knocking within
Knocking within
Knocking within
Opens the gate
Enter MACDUFF and LENNOX

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Was it so late, friend, ere you went to bed, That you do lie so late

lines.speaker: porter
lines.text: Faith sir, we were carousing till the second cock: and drink, sir, is a great provoker of three things.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: What three things does drink especially provoke

lines.speaker: porter
lines.text: Marry, sir, nosepainting, sleep, and urine. Lechery, sir, it provokes, and unprovokes it provokes the desire, but it takes away the performance: therefore, much drink may be said to be an equivocator with lechery: it makes him, and it mars him it sets him on, and it takes him off it persuades him, and disheartens him makes him stand to, and not stand to in conclusion, equivocates him in a sleep, and, giving him the lie, leaves him.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: I believe drink gave thee the lie last night.

lines.speaker: porter
lines.text: That it did, sir, i the very throat on me: but I requited him for his lie and, I think, being too strong for him, though he took up my legs sometime, yet I made a shift to cast him.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Is thy master stirring Our knocking has awaked him here he comes.
Enter MACBETH

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Good morrow, noble sir.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Good morrow, both.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Is the king stirring, worthy thane

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: He did command me to call timely on him: I have almost slippd the hour.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Ill bring you to him.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: I know this is a joyful trouble to you But yet tis one.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: The labour we delight in physics pain. This is the door.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Ill make so bold to call, For tis my limited service.
Exit

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Goes the king hence today

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: He does: he did appoint so.

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: The night has been unruly: where we lay, Our chimneys were blown down and, as they say, Lamentings heard i the air strange screams of death, And prophesying with accents terrible Of dire combustion and confused events New hatchd to the woeful time: the obscure bird Clamourd the livelong night: some say, the earth Was feverous and did shake.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Twas a rough night.

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: My young remembrance cannot parallel A fellow to it.
Reenter MACDUFF

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: O horror, horror, horror! Tongue nor heart Cannot conceive nor name thee!

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Whats the matter.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Confusion now hath made his masterpiece! Most sacrilegious murder hath broke ope The Lords anointed temple, and stole thence The life o the building!

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: What is t you say the life

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Mean you his majesty

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Approach the chamber, and destroy your sight With a new Gorgon: do not bid me speak See, and then speak yourselves. Awake, awake! Ring the alarumbell. Murder and treason! Banquo and Donalbain! Malcolm! awake! Shake off this downy sleep, deaths counterfeit, And look on death itself! up, up, and see The great dooms image! Malcolm! Banquo! As from your graves rise up, and walk like sprites, To countenance this horror! Ring the bell.
Exeunt MACBETH and LENNOX
Bell rings
Enter LADY MACBETH

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Whats the business, That such a hideous trumpet calls to parley The sleepers of the house speak, speak!

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: O gentle lady, Tis not for you to hear what I can speak: The repetition, in a womans ear, Would murder as it fell. O Banquo, Banquo, Our royal master s murderd!
Enter BANQUO

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Woe, alas! What, in our house

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Too cruel any where. Dear Duff, I prithee, contradict thyself, And say it is not so.
Reenter MACBETH and LENNOX, with ROSS

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Had I but died an hour before this chance, I had lived a blessed time for, from this instant, There s nothing serious in mortality: All is but toys: renown and grace is dead The wine of life is drawn, and the mere lees Is left this vault to brag of.
Enter MALCOLM and DONALBAIN

lines.speaker: donalbain
lines.text: What is amiss

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: You are, and do not knowt: The spring, the head, the fountain of your blood Is stoppd the very source of it is stoppd.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Your royal father s murderd.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: O, by whom

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Those of his chamber, as it seemd, had done t: Their hands and faces were an badged with blood So were their daggers, which unwiped we found Upon their pillows: They stared, and were distracted no mans life Was to be trusted with them.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: O, yet I do repent me of my fury, That I did kill them.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Wherefore did you so

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Who can be wise, amazed, temperate and furious, Loyal and neutral, in a moment No man: The expedition my violent love Outrun the pauser, reason. Here lay Duncan, His silver skin laced with his golden blood And his gashd stabs lookd like a breach in nature For ruins wasteful entrance: there, the murderers, Steepd in the colours of their trade, their daggers Unmannerly breechd with gore: who could refrain, That had a heart to love, and in that heart Courage to make s love kno wn

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Help me hence, ho!

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Look to the lady.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: [Aside to DONALBAIN]  Why do we hold our tongues, That most may claim this argument for ours

lines.speaker: donalbain
lines.text: [Aside to MALCOLM]  What should be spoken here, where our fate, Hid in an augerhole, may rush, and seize us Let s away Our tears are not yet brewd.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: [Aside to DONALBAIN]        Nor our strong sorrow Upon the foot of motion.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Look to the lady: And when we have our naked frailties hid, That suffer in exposure, let us meet, And question this most bloody piece of work, To know it further. Fears and scruples shake us: In the great hand of God I stand and thence Against the undivulged pretence I fight Of treasonous malice.
LADY MACBETH is carried out

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: And so do I.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: So all.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Lets briefly put on manly readiness, And meet i the hall together.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Well contented.
Exeunt all but Malcolm and Donalbain.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: What will you do Lets not consort with them: To show an unfelt sorrow is an office Which the false man does easy. Ill to England.

lines.speaker: donalbain
lines.text: To Ireland, I our separated fortune Shall keep us both the safer: where we are, Theres daggers in mens smiles: the near in blood, The nearer bloody.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: This murderous shaft thats shot Hath not yet lighted, and our safest way Is to avoid the aim. Therefore, to horse And let us not be dainty of leavetaking, But shift away: theres warrant in that theft Which steals itself, when theres no mercy left.
Exeunt
